intro: Scorpiurus, commonly known as the common scorpionweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves, which are typically opposite in arrangement. The flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the family. Scorpiurus species are native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and Africa, often growing in disturbed or sandy soils. These plants are generally herbaceous, with some species exhibiting annual or perennial life cycles.
